crisis.bannerText: If you or someone you know is in crisis, call or text
crisis.forThe: for the National Suicide and Crisis Lifeline
crisis.textLine: Text HELLO for Crisis Text Line

footer.description: Providing hope, healing, and support through Catholic mental health ministry and suicide prevention.
footer.copyright: Breath of Life Ministries. All rights reserved.

home.heroSubtitle: Finding hope and healing through faith, community, and compassionate support
home.missionText1: Breath of Life Ministries provides vital spiritual accompaniment for people experiencing mental health challenges and mental illness, as well as those who care for them.
home.missionText2: Rooted in Catholic teaching and compassion, we offer hope, resources, and community support for suicide prevention and mental wellness. Every person is created in the image and likeness of God, possessing infinite dignity and worth.
home.immediateHelpSubtitle: If you or someone you know is in crisis, help is available right now.
home.inCrisisText: If you're experiencing a mental health crisis:
home.connectCounselor: Connect with a crisis counselor via text, anytime day or night.
home.chatOnline: Chat with a trained counselor online through secure messaging.
home.speakWithPriest: Speak with a priest or pastoral minister in your area.
home.findComfort: Find comfort in faith, sacraments, and your parish community during difficult times.
home.catholicTeaching: Catholic Teaching on Suicide & Mental Health
home.catholicTeachingText: The Catholic Church recognizes that suicide is a grave matter, but emphasizes God's infinite mercy and understanding of mental health issues. The Church teaches that psychological disturbances, anguish, grave fear of hardship, suffering, or torture can diminish the responsibility of the person who dies by suicide.
home.catechismQuote: We should not despair of the eternal salvation of persons who have taken their own lives. By ways known to him alone, God can provide the opportunity for salutary repentance.
home.catholicTeachingText2: Our ministry approaches mental health and suicide prevention with compassion, recognizing that those who struggle deserve our prayers, support, and accompaniment on their journey toward healing.
home.programsSubtitle: Comprehensive support, training, and resources for mental health and suicide prevention
home.suicidePreventionDesc: Learn practical skills to recognize warning signs and intervene effectively to help save lives. Our evidence-based training equips community members with knowledge and confidence to support those in crisis.
home.supportGroupsDesc: Connect with others who understand the challenges of mental illness or the loss of a loved one to suicide. Find community, hope, and healing in a faith-filled environment where you're never alone.
home.griefMinistryDesc: Compassionate support for those who have lost a loved one to suicide. We offer specialized resources, prayer support, and accompaniment through the journey of grief and healing.
home.educationDesc: Workshops, seminars, and resources to break the stigma around mental illness and promote understanding within the Catholic community and beyond.
home.spiritualAccompanimentDesc: Faith-based support that honors the Catholic tradition while providing practical help for those facing mental health challenges. Prayer, sacraments, and pastoral care.
home.parishPartnershipsDesc: We partner with Catholic parishes to establish mental health ministries, providing consultation, training, and ongoing support to create welcoming, informed faith communities.
home.patronSaintsSubtitle: Throughout history, the Church has recognized saints who intercede for those suffering from mental illness and distress.
home.stThereseDesc: is invoked for depression and anxiety. Her "Little Way" teaches us that even in our smallest struggles, God's love is present.
home.stDymphnaDesc: is the patron saint of those with mental illness and nervous disorders.
home.stBenedictDesc: suffered from mental illness himself and is a powerful intercessor for those who struggle.
home.featuredResourcesSubtitle: Books, training, and support materials for individuals, families, and faith communities
home.lovedOneDies: When a Loved One Dies by Suicide
home.lovedOneDiesDesc: Personal stories of loss, coping with grief, and finding hope through faith and community. Written by Catholics who have experienced this profound loss.
home.respondingToSuicideDesc: The first book written for Catholic leaders that takes a holistic approach to understanding suicide and ministering effectively in its aftermath.
home.prayerLiturgyDesc: Sacred resources for worship, prayer services, and liturgical guidance for mental health awareness and suicide prevention.
home.agriSafeDesc: Protecting the health and safety of agricultural workers and their families through education, training, and resources for rural communities.
home.hopeHealingSubtitle: Stories of faith, recovery, and the compassionate support that makes a difference
home.testimonial1: The Church's teaching on God's mercy gave me hope when I thought all was lost. Mental illness doesn't diminish God's love for us.
home.testimonial2: Suicide prevention training equipped our parish to respond with compassion and confidence. We've become a community of hope for those who suffer.
home.connectSubtitle: We're here to support you on your journey toward healing and hope
home.bringingCompassion: Bringing the compassion of Christ to those affected by mental illness and suicide.
home.bringTraining: Bring suicide prevention training to your parish
home.name: Name
home.subject: Subject

prayerRequest.title: Submit a Prayer Request
prayerRequest.subtitle: Share your intentions with our prayer community
prayerRequest.introText1: In times of struggle, uncertainty, or grief, we believe in the power of prayer and community. Your prayer intentions are sacred to us, and our ministry is committed to lifting them up in prayer.
prayerRequest.introText2: Whether you're facing mental health challenges, grieving a loss, supporting a loved one, or simply need spiritual strength, we invite you to share your prayer request with us.
prayerRequest.scripture: "Do not be anxious about anything, but in every situation, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving, present your requests to God."
prayerRequest.namePlaceholder: How would you like us to address you in prayer?
prayerRequest.emailPlaceholder: Only if you'd like us to follow up with you
prayerRequest.intentionPlaceholder: Share what's on your heart. Your intention will be treated with complete confidentiality and reverence...
prayerRequest.followUp: I would like someone from the ministry to follow up with me
prayerRequest.successMessage: Thank you for sharing your prayer intention with us. Your request has been received and will be lifted up in prayer by our ministry community. You are not alone.
prayerRequest.errorMessage: There was a problem submitting your prayer request. Please try again or contact us directly.
prayerRequest.whatHappens1Text: Your prayer request is received confidentially by our ministry team.
prayerRequest.whatHappens2Text: Your intention is included in our daily prayers and offered at Mass.
prayerRequest.whatHappens3Text: If requested, a team member will reach out to offer additional support.
prayerRequest.scripture1: "Come to me, all you who are weary and burdened, and I will give you rest."
prayerRequest.scripture2: "The Lord is close to the brokenhearted and saves those who are crushed in spirit."
prayerRequest.scripture3: "Cast all your anxiety on him because he cares for you."
prayerRequest.stDymphnaIntro: St. Dymphna is the patron saint of those suffering from mental illness and nervous disorders. We pray this prayer for all who submit intentions:
prayerRequest.stDymphnaPrayer: Lord, our God, you graciously chose St. Dymphna as patroness of those afflicted with mental and nervous disorders. She is thus an inspiration and a symbol of charity to the thousands who ask her intercession. Please grant, Lord, through the prayers of this pure youthful martyr, relief and consolation to all suffering such trials, and especially those for whom we pray. We beg you, Lord, to hear the prayers of St. Dymphna on our behalf. Grant all those for whom we pray patience in their sufferings and resignation to your divine will. Please fill them with hope, and grant them the relief and cure they so much desire. We ask this through Christ our Lord. Amen.
prayerRequest.crisisText: If you or someone you know is in crisis, please reach out to these resources:
